page.title: 08Brinklow's places of worship
page.content: The{church}of St.John the Baptist is open early each morning until late each night. It was built in the 13th century and was partly rebuilt towards the end of the 15th century. The interior was extensively restored in the 19th century. An unusual feature of this church is the floor which slopes nearly 12 feet from west to east.The oldest parts of the church are the north aisle and the walls of the choir and chancel.The font,nave and tower are all 15th century.The tower has an angel at the top of an unusually twisted great arch.There are 6 bells, 5 are dated 1705 and one is 1913.In the church there is a book of the history of Brinklow compiled by members of the local Women's Institute.There is also a{chapel further down Broad Street.
